text: today's recipe for turkeys skillet pie
comes from our one pop book the great
celebration of one pot recipes we've
been having and this is another
fantastic one that I think you're really
gonna enjoy I'm starting by getting my
dry ingredients ready for my biscuits I
have 1 cup of all-purpose flour a
teaspoon of baking powder 1/4 teaspoon
of baking soda and a quarter teaspoon of
salt whisk them together
and then you can just set these aside I
just like to get this ready and then
later I'm gonna add some cold butter
cheese and buttermilk we want to saute
your aromatics first and I'm making the
whole thing in a skillet our book is
separated by the vessel and we have
skillet Dutch oven slow cookers
everything that you could want all in
one pot today I'm using a cast-iron
skillet but any ovenproof skillet would
do heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil
and then add one white onion thinly
sliced 1 red bell pepper also sliced and
8 ounces of mushrooms also thinly slice
if you buy whole mushrooms make sure
that you clean them off first I advocate
rinsing them in water
ok everything until the mushrooms that
have released some of their liquid and
everything cooks down a bit that should
take about 8 minutes these vegetables
have softened quite a bit they're
looking good
so that add one and a half pounds of
ground turkey I'm using all dark meat
but you can use a combination if you
want to I do think that the dark meat
has more moisture and I like that better
but some people prefer the meanness of
the all white meat seasoned with salt
and pepper
and then a tablespoon of chili powder
two tablespoons of tomato paste before I
had my liquid I like to just cook out
the spices a little bit they mellow a
little bit and blend with everything
really nicely cast iron skillet might be
my favorite pad I don't like to choose
favorites but this might be it this is a
fourteen and a half ounce can of diced
tomatoes those can go in with your
turkey and it just needs to cook
together for a few minutes you don't
want to overcook it or over reduce it
you want a little of the liquid to cook
at but there's not a ton of liquid in
there to begin with you want the turkey
to lose its rawness but not completely
be covered because it's going to go into
your 425 degree oven for like 20 minutes
with the biscuits on top so I'm gonna
turn it off and finish up my biscuits I
have two tablespoons of cold butter that
needs to be cut into your flour mixture
I always just go for my fingers work
quickly until the entire mixture has the
texture of like a coarse meal and there
might be some pieces of butter left
about the size of small peas add six
ounces of grated cheddar cheese you can
use the yellow you can use the whites up
to you toss all the dry ingredients with
the cheese and then stir in 1/3 of a cup
of buttermilk you want to make sure that
your dough is fully moistened so if
there are pieces of flour in the bottom
of your bowl make sure that they get
mixed into the dough I'm gonna use my
fingers to do that to ensure flaky
biscuits you want to make sure you don't
overwork your dough now you're gonna
want to drop these biscuits on top of
your turkey mixture drop your biscuits
make about nine biscuits to divide it
approximately evenly and just put it on
top it's kind of like dumplings but
southwestern style I'm not getting nine
mine are too big pop your pie into a
425-degree oven and bake it until the
biscuits are puffed and golden about 20
minutes
Goldin delightfulness the cheese is
melted and given the biscuits a nice
golden hue so maybe the orange cheese is
good for this it has such a beautiful
color and love it
southwestern Turkey skillet pie you're
gonna love it and it's from our new 1/5
burger
